titlStmt.titl: Public Attitudes in Alberta Toward the Formerly Mentally Ill, 1990

citation.biblCit: Odynak, Dave; Krahn, Harvey; Gartrell, John; Kinzel, Cliff, 2015, "Public Attitudes in Alberta Toward the Formerly Mentally Ill, 1990", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/10592, UAL Dataverse, V1

titlStmt.titl: Public Attitudes in Alberta Toward the Formerly Mentally Ill, 1990

rspStmt.AuthEnty: Odynak, Dave; Krahn, Harvey; Gartrell, John; Kinzel, Cliff

stdyInfo.abstract: This study was designed to collect data comparable to previous studies on attitudes toward the mentally ill as well as new information pertaining to the formerly mentally ill. Many of the questions used in this survey came from the 1986 Winnipeg Area Survey.

sumDscr.universe: The overall sample was constructed from three independent sub-samples. Within each sub-provincial area, households were randomly selected using telephone numbers generated from a set of working banks maintained by the Population Research Laboratory. The use of random digit dialing techniques (RDD) provided both listed and unlisted telephone numbers in the samples. Roughly equal numbers of completed interviews were collected in each sub-area of the province
